benchmark_details.name: Video Thinking Test (Video-TT)
benchmark_details.overview: Video-TT assesses the correctness and robustness of video large language models in understanding complex real-world videos, specifically addressing the ability to interpret visual narratives and handle adversarial conditions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for video language models regarding their understanding of complex narratives and their robustness in adversarial settings.

data.source: 1,000 YouTube Shorts videos, each with one main question and four related adversarial questions.
data.annotation: Structured by human annotators focusing on visual and narrative complexity.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is based on the percentage of correct answers across various question types.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of models in understanding video content compared to human benchmarks.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance at 84.3% accuracy; models significantly lag behind.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was tested against several leading video LLMs to validate its efficacy.
